title: 'A lot more drama': Scouts, insiders weigh in on the Knicks' championship potential
content: These aren't your Thibs-era Knicks. Is that a good thing? ESPN's NBA insiders dive into New York's uneven 4-3 start.

title: Cardinals placing QB Murray on injured reserve
content: The Cardinals are placing QB Kyler Murray on IR with a foot injury that kept him out since Week 5, meaning he'll miss at least four more games. Jacoby Brissett will start.

title: Jets demote LB Williams amid defensive shakeup
content: In addition to trading cornerstone players Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams, the Jets have demoted former All-Pro linebacker Quincy Williams.

title: Curry, Butler, Sabonis, LaVine out for GS vs. SAC
content: The Warriors and Kings will be without several starters Wednesday night in Sacramento with Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler III being ruled out for Golden State, and Domantas Sabonis and Zach LaVine out for the Kings.

title: Tiger's son joins dad with All-America selection
content: High school junior Charlie Woods, the son of 15-time major champion Tiger Woods, was named a first-team All-American by the AJGA.

title: Colts energized by Sauce trade, eye CB's debut
content: Sauce Gardner joined his new Colts teammates and intends to play against the Falcons in Berlin if he clears concussion protocol.

title: McIlroy gets 'gracious' apology over Ryder abuse
content: Rory McIlroy said he got a personal apology from PGA of America CEO Derek Sprague over the abuse he and his wife endured at the Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black in September.

title: Jazz C Kessler set for season-ending surgery
content: Jazz center Walker Kessler will undergo season-ending surgery to repair a torn labrum in his left shoulder.

title: MLB offseason rumors and buzz: What we're hearing as free agency begins
content: Will Tarik Skubal be dealt? Who could sign Kyle Schwarber and Kyle Tucker? Here's what we're hearing as the 2025-26 hot stove ignites.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: Graziano & Fowler: What we're hearing on the Jets, Cowboys, Dolphins, Seahawks and more
content: What's the fallout from the Jets' blockbuster trades? What about other moves that did or did not happen around the league? We have the latest.

title: Winners, losers of a wild trade deadline: Solak weighs in on Jets, Cowboys and Jakobi Meyers
content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the trade deadline?

title: Champions League as it happened: Man City breeze past BVB, six goals in Brugge-Barça
content: Enjoy all the action from Wednesday's UEFA Champions League games, such as Manchester City vs. Borussia Dortmund and Club Brugge vs. Barcelona.

title: Five key questions that will shape the 2026 women's NCAA bracket
content: The SEC race and Big Ten's nonconference performance could have the biggest impact on the women's NCAA bracket.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Most impactful newcomers on all 30 teams
content: NBA insiders break down the most impactful player, rookie or coach and where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

title: Sauce Gardner traded?!? Barnwell on the Colts' risky all-in move and what comes next
content: The Colts shocked the NFL by dealing two first-round picks and Adonai Mitchell to the Jets for Sauce Gardner. But is this the right time to get aggressive?

title: Jets trade Sauce Gardner to Colts: Last piece to Super Bowl puzzle? What's N.Y. thinking?
content: The 7-2 Colts are going all-in on a Super Bowl run, while trading the CB was just part of the Jets' busy day.

title: 'Are you serious?': How the LSU band got a 66 year-old tuba player
content: This season hasn't gone according to plan for LSU, but one member of the school's band is living his dream.

title: Who makes the Olympic hockey cut? Roster predictions for U.S., Canada, more
content: The NHL is back at the Games (Feb. 11-22). Here's a look at which players will make the cut for the big five.

title: How the Kraken's Joey Daccord uses VR for goalie excellence
content: Sense Arena is the first NHL/NHLPA-licensed virtual and mixed-reality platform, and players are using it to train.

title: How the Blue Jays nearly took down a baseball superpower -- and how it could change MLB
content: Toronto almost dethroned the mighty Dodgers by prioritizing contact. Will other teams follow the model?

title: Last Dance: Playoffs will define the MLS legacy of Inter Miami's Fantastic Four
content: With Jordi Alba and Sergio Busquets retiring after the season, it's time for Inter Miami's cast of former Barcelona standouts to put up or shut up.

title: USWNT big board: Girma, Rodman injuries cloud 2027 World Cup plans
content: If the 2027 World Cup started today, which players would be on the UWSNT roster? Jeff Kassouf takes a look at who is -- and who isn't -- going to make the cut.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: J.J. McCarthy, Kimani Vidal and other tough lineup decisions
content: You didn't draft any of these eight guys to be starters, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't consider it.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Wan'Dale Robinson, downgrade Kimani Vidal
content: The most and least favorable matchups for this week's games at the four key positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Broncos, Bills among top options in Week 10
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 10, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Is now the best time to trade Austin Reaves?
content: A closer look at Austin Reaves' incredible early-season production, and whether it's wise for fantasy managers to trade him now.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the São Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Women's boxing divisional rankings: New No. 1 at junior middleweight
content: Mikaela Mayer is ranked in two divisions following her win over Mary Spencer at 154 pounds. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona, Bayern eyeing Vlahovic
content: Several European clubs are linked with a move for Juventus' Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: "Let's Get To Work": Zohran Mamdani In First Post After Historic Win
content: After sealing a groundbreaking win, Zohran Mamdani took to X with a message that captured the weight of the moment, "Thank you, New York City. Together we made history. Now let's get to work."

title: What Rahul Gandhi Told "Gen Z Brothers And Sisters" Day Before Bihar Voting
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi repeated his "vote chori (theft)" allegation on Wednesday as he reached out to whom he called "Gen Z brothers and sisters" to decide Bihar's future.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Victory Fires Up Europe's Left Against Right-Wing Surge At Home
content: The blistering rise of Zohran Mamdani to become mayor of New York City has offered encouragement to left-wing parties across Europe that an unabashedly radical agenda could help turn the tide against right-wing forces at home.

title: Hamas To Hand Over Hostage Body As Gaza Ceasefire Holds Amid Strikes
content: Hamas' armed wing said it would hand over the body of a hostage at 9 pm (1900 GMT) on Wednesday, while the Israeli military said it had killed two Palestinians who had approached an area it occupied in a "threatening" way.

title: Prostitution Racket Busted At Visakhapatnam Spa, 3 Arrested
content: The Visakhapatnam City Police's Task Force, in a joint operation with the 3rd Town police, conducted a raid on a prominent wellness centre near VIP Road.

title: Irans 'Hostage Diplomacy': How Tehran Uses Arrests To Extract Concessions
content: Iran, since the Islamic revolution, has employed the tactic of arresting Westerners in a bid to extract concessions from its foes, in a strategy of "hostage diplomacy" that has long presented Europe and the US with a dilemma.

title: 'If They Do This To Me': Man Gropes Mexican President, Tries To Kiss Her
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum called on Wednesday for making sexual harassment a criminal offence nationwide after a man groped and tried to kiss her as she walked down the street.

title: Miss Universe 2025 Sashing Ceremony Delayed As Queens Walk Out After Heated Exchange
content: The 74th Miss Universe pageant is off to a rocky start after a heated exchange took place between the participants and the hosts, Miss Universe Thailand (MUT) national director, just as the ceremonial sashing of candidates was about to begin.

title: 'Never Seen Men So Scared, Want US Cabinet Like That': Trump On Xi's Officials
content: In a meeting with Republican senators at a White House breakfast, US President Donald Trump recounted his bilateral meeting with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping and his officials. "I've never seen men so scared in my life," Trump said.

title: 30-Year-Old Was Bowling, Stopped To Have Water. Then Collapsed And Died
content: A 30-year-old Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) development officer collapsed and died while playing cricket in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi Wednesday morning.

title: Gwalior Girl Fights Off 3 Men Who Tried To Kidnap Her Near Police Station
content: A shocking incident in Gwalior has once again raised alarming questions about women's safety. This time, right under the nose of the police. Three men in an autorickshaw allegedly tried to kidnap a first-year student in broad daylight.

title: Punjab Congress Chief Raja Warring Charged For 'Casteist Remarks'
content: Punjab police registered an FIR against Punjab Congress President and MP Amrinder Singh alias Raja Warring for allegedly making derogatory and casteist remarks against former Union Home Minister Late Buta Singh.

title: Sitting Pirpainti MLA Lalan Kumar Joins RJD, Quits BJP Ahead Of Polls
content: Lalan Kumar, sitting Pirpainti MLA from Bihar, on Wednesday joined Lalu Prasad Yadav's Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in the run-up to the assembly elections, scheduled to be held in two phases on November 6 and 11.

title: Imran Khan Accuses Pak Army Chief Asim Munir Of "Tyranny", Calls Him "Mentally Unstable"
content: From behind bars, former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has renewed his fierce criticism of Army Chief Field Marshal Asim Munir, branding him the "most oppressive dictator in Pakistan's history" and "a mentally unstable man."

title: Nandini Ghee Price Increased By Rs 90 Per Litre
content: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) on Wednesday announced that it has increased the price of Nandini ghee by Rs 90 per litre, bringing it to Rs 700 per litre.

title: 9,000 Challans, 500 Inspections In 24 Hours As Delhi Steps Up Pollution Enforcement
content: Delhi authorities carried out over 500 inspections and issued more than 9,000 vehicular challans in the past 24 hours as part of ongoing efforts to control pollution. As per official data, the city's Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 202 on Wednesday.

title: Husband, Wife Fight Each Other To Death In Jharkhand: Police
content: Sanjay Singh, the Jan Suraaj Party candidate from Bihar's Munger Assembly seat, joined the BJP on Wednesday, on the eve of the first phase of assembly elections, officials said.

title: NDA Candidate Claims She Was Attacked In Bihar, Police Say No Evidence
content: Jyoti Manjhi, the sitting MLA from Barachatti, was allegedly attacked by unknown men during the election campaign. The police, though, after a preliminary inquiry, said there is no evidence of any attack.

title: Tirupati Temple Plans To Use AI To Slash Pilgrim Wait Times To 2 Hours
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam (TTD) Board, led by Chairman B R Naidu, is planning to launch an ambitious digital drive to eliminate long queues and reduce the average pilgrim darshan waiting time to just two hours using Artificial Intelligence.

title: Sharad Pawar's NCP Sets 'No BJP' Rule Ahead Of Maharashtra Civic Polls
content: With the first phase of Maharashtra's long-delayed civic polls scheduled to be held on December 2, Opposition parties have begun working out the electoral math.

title: Gujarat riots: 'Hard videographic proof' vanishes; court acquits 3 accused
content: An Ahmedabad court acquitted three men accused in the 2002 riots, citing a lack of evidence. The videographer who claimed to have captured them with firearms, including an AK-47, recanted his statement and the crucial tape vanished. Many witnesses also turned hostile during the 23-year trial, leading to the acquittal.

title: Microsoft president Brad Smith sends memo to employees on 'Gaza spying' report
content: Microsoft is enhancing its internal reporting system with a new "Trusted Technology Review" feature, allowing employees to flag ethical concerns about technology development and deployment. This move comes amid mounting pressure regarding the company's role in Israel's military operations. The tech giant is also strengthening its pre-contract review for sensitive projects, emphasizing human rights due diligence.

title: 'Never seen men so scared': Trump wants his cabinet to 'behave' like Xi’s
content: Donald Trump recounted a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, joking about the rigid and silent demeanor of Xi's delegation. He described the Chinese officials as "so scared in their lives" and "at attention," even when addressed directly. Trump humorously expressed a desire for his own cabinet to exhibit similar discipline.

title: Platform friction: Amazon warns Perplexity over its Comet browser; asks to stop bots
content: Amazon has issued a cease-and-desist to Perplexity AI over its Comet browser agent making purchases. Amazon alleges fraud and terms violations, claiming Comet degrades the shopping experience and creates privacy risks. Perplexity counters, accusing Amazon of anti-competitive behavior and protecting its ad revenue, marking a significant clash over autonomous AI agents.

title: RCB set to be sold, likely to get new owner before March 31
content: United Spirits Limited, a Diageo subsidiary, is reviewing its ownership of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) franchise, including both men's and women's teams.  The strategic move, expected to conclude by March 2026, aims to focus on USL's core alcohol-beverage business.  Despite a recent controversy, RCB remains a valuable asset due to its star players and strong fan base.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: US tests ‘doomsday’ ballistic missile days after Trump vows to restart nuclear testing
content: The US Air Force successfully launched an unarmed Minuteman III ICBM, a test scheduled months in advance. This event follows President Trump's recent call to restart nuclear weapons testing, reigniting debate over US nuclear policy and arms control. The Minuteman III remains a crucial part of America's strategic deterrence.

title: Gisele Bündchen says prioritizing Tom Brady for years took a deep personal toll
content: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: George Springer’s wife Charlise breaks silence after Blue Jays’ WS heartbreak
content: The Toronto Blue Jays' World Series dream ended in heartbreak, but George Springer's wife, Charlise, offered a message of gratitude and pride. Her words highlighted the team's resilience and the lasting memories created, reminding fans that baseball's true value lies in connection and shared moments, not just wins. The team vows to 'run it back' next season.

title: Split-screen politics in Bihar: Rahul jabs PM with 'Ambani' remark; RJD feels pinch
content: Rahul Gandhi's recent rally remarks in Bihar, targeting PM Modi's performative politics and corporate ties, subtly highlighted Congress's own aspirations. This comes amid a tense seat-sharing tussle with ally RJD, exposing the INDIA bloc's internal power dynamics. The situation mirrors similar patterns where allies, like RJD, once emerged by eroding Congress's base, now vie for dominance.

title: William Nylander opens up on his frustration and Maple Leafs’ struggles
content: William Nylander expressed his frustration with being sidelined due to injury, admitting the waiting game is wearing him down. His absence has impacted the Maple Leafs' offense and overall rhythm. Despite playing limited games, Nylander remains a crucial scorer, and his premature return could jeopardize the team's playoff aspirations.

title: Puka Nacua’s ex Hallie Aiono shares newborn moments as Rams star reacts
content: Hallie Aiono, ex-girlfriend of Puka Nacua, shared the first photos of their newborn son, Kingston, born October 30. Aiono expressed her joy and gratitude for her baby, calling him a miracle amidst challenging circumstances. The birth comes as a paternity case involving Nacua remains ongoing, drawing public attention to both the new family and the legal proceedings.

title: US govt shutdown breaks record: Trump attacks 'Kamikaze' Democrats; makes big claim
content: US President Donald Trump labelled Democrats 'kamikaze' as the US government shutdown, now the longest in history, enters its sixth week. Millions of federal workers face unpaid leave or working without pay, impacting essential services like airports and welfare programs. A dispute over healthcare spending fuels the deadlock, with both parties showing little willingness to compromise, threatening further chaos.

title: ‘Kramnik 2.0 in the works’: Nepo lambasted for ‘complaints’ after loss to India's Ghosh
content: Indian Grandmaster Diptayan Ghosh achieved a monumental upset at the World Chess Cup, defeating former world championship challenger Ian Nepomniachtchi. Ghosh capitalized on his opponent's errors to secure a memorable victory. Following the match, Nepomniachtchi's online comments about the conditions drew significant criticism from fans, while other Indian players also progressed.

title: Man vs wild: Japan deploys military to combat deadly bear attack
content: Japan's military has been deployed in northern regions to combat a surge in deadly bear attacks. Authorities suspect climate change is disrupting food sources, forcing bears into populated areas. Over 100 attacks and a record 12 fatalities have been reported, prompting unusual measures like military assistance and relaxed gun laws to manage the growing human-wildlife conflict.

title: From NYC To Virginia: 3 Indian-origin Democrats trounce Trump; how they did it
content: Three Indian-origin Democrats, Zohran Mamdani, Aftab Pureval, and Ghazala Hashmi, secured significant victories in New York City, Cincinnati, and Virginia, respectively. These wins offer a crucial boost to the Democratic party, signaling a strong comeback and reshaping the political landscape ahead of future elections. Their success highlights a message of disapproval towards Donald Trump's policies.

title: IBM layoffs: Arvind Krishna shares lessons; tips for Gen Z to stay ahead
content: Major tech firms like IBM are cutting jobs to focus on AI and software, creating uncertainty for young professionals. While some roles may be reduced by automation, IBM plans to hire more graduates. Gen Z should prioritize AI skills, continuous learning, and adaptability to navigate this evolving job market and turn challenges into opportunities.

title: Bombay HC quashes Rs 22 crore tax notice based on AI-generated case-laws
content: A taxpayer successfully challenged a Rs 22 crore tax demand after the Income Tax Department cited three non-existent court rulings, allegedly suggested by AI. The Bombay High Court found procedural irregularities and breaches of natural justice, nullifying the assessment and ordering a fresh notice with verified citations.

title: James Cook injury update: Bills RB doubtful for Week 10 vs Dolphins
content: Star running back James Cook's foot and ankle injuries cast doubt on his availability for the Buffalo Bills' crucial Week 10 matchup against the Miami Dolphins.  His potential absence places increased pressure on the team's depth players, Ray Davis and Ty Johnson, to carry the load and maintain offensive momentum.

title: NYC picks Mamdani for Mayor: Big Apple has fallen far from its capitalist tree – to a socialist
content: Zohran Mamdani's New York City mayoral win, infused with Indian cultural elements, faces immediate Republican opposition and Islamophobic attacks. Despite challenges from president Trump and threats of millionaire exodus, Mamdani, a young Muslim democratic socialist, defiantly asserts his identity and commitment to his promises, signaling a new era for the city.

title: Mamdani elected NYC Mayor: Why its a big loss for Trump; bad sign for mid-term polls?
content: Zohran Mamdani's historic New York City mayoral win, alongside Democratic victories in New Jersey and Virginia, signals a significant defeat for Donald Trump and his endorsed candidates. These off-year election results reflect widespread voter discontent with economic issues and Trump's policies, serving as an early warning for the Republican Party ahead of the 2026 mid-term elections.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals RB’s Week 10 uncertain after knee issue
content: The Arizona Cardinals' running game faces uncertainty as Trey Benson remains questionable for Week 10.  Since Benson's injury, the team has rotated Bam Knight, Emari Demercado, and Michael Carter without consistent success.  If Benson doesn't return, Demercado and Knight will likely continue to share carries.

title: Muslim, socialist & more: 5 reasons why Trump's Maga hates NYC Mayor Mamdani
content: New York has elected Zohran Mamdani, a Muslim, African-born democratic socialist, as its youngest mayor in over a century. His victory, celebrated by progressives, is seen as a significant challenge to MAGA ideology, embodying cultural shifts and progressive policies that alarm Donald Trump and his supporters.

title: Russia to resume nuke tests? Putin gives order to officials — what he said
content: Russia's President Putin has directed officials to prepare for potential nuclear tests, responding to US President Trump's remarks hinting at a possible resumption of atomic testing. Putin reiterated Russia's stance of only testing if the US does first, emphasizing readiness for any scenario amid global denuclearization concerns and recent Russian weapons trials.

title: Rahul's appeal to 'Gen Z' on eve of Bihar polls; urges youth to prevent 'vote chori'
content: Rahul Gandhi urged Bihar's Gen Z voters to protect democracy by voting against alleged "vote theft" conspiracies. He highlighted concerns over electoral manipulation in other states and called for vigilance at polling booths. Gandhi encouraged young first-time voters to support the Mahagathbandhan, emphasizing truth and non-violence to safeguard Bihar's future and awaken the state.

title: Inside Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s wedding: Date, dress & big details
content: Speculation is rife that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are planning a wedding for June 13, 2026, a date rich with personal significance for the couple.  Industry insiders anticipate a spectacular event, with designers reportedly vying to create Swift's bridal gown.  This union is poised to be a defining pop culture moment of the decade.

title: The OG 'Jan Nayak': Why Karpoori Thakur is the flavour of Bihar elections 2025
content: Bihar's election season sees a fierce battle for the 'Jan Nayak' title, with parties invoking socialist icon Karpoori Thakur's legacy. His emphasis on social justice and humble origins resonates as politicians seek to connect with voters, highlighting a yearning for integrity in politics.

title: Women's WC: PM Modi hosts champions - here’s what happened at felicitation meeting
content: Prime Minister Modi celebrated the Women's World Cup champions on Wednesday, lauding their comeback and resilience. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed a desire for more frequent meetings with the PM, while Smriti Mandhana hailed him as an inspiration. Discussions touched upon personal strengths, memorable moments, and the importance of promoting fitness among young girls nationwide.

title: ‘Cup of tea’ in Kabul proved costly: Pak's FM calls it a mistake; pledges not to repeat
content: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar labeled a "cup of tea" meeting in Kabul a "costly mistake" by the previous government, which he claims opened borders to Afghanistan and led to a surge in terrorist attacks.  Afghanistan's foreign ministry has disputed Dar's account of communication, stating their initial contact was for mutual understanding.

title: 'Chopped, buried under kitchen': Chilling details of Gujarat horror; wife on the run
content: Ahmedabad Police unearthed a chilling murder plot, finding a man's remains buried beneath his kitchen floor. His wife, allegedly in league with her lover and his relatives, is accused of killing him nearly a year ago. The couple reportedly plotted the murder after the victim confronted his wife about an affair.

title: This is the way: How 'Mando' Mamdani turned NYC into Big Blue Apple
content: New York has elected its first Muslim and South Asian mayor, Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist. Coverage highlights this historic win and the generational shift it represents. While celebrated by progressives, concerns linger among business leaders and moderates regarding his radical agenda and limited experience, signaling a potential shake-up in urban politics.

title: 'Misleading the nation': Haryana CM rebuts Rahul's 'H-Files'; calls Cong 'agenda-less'
content: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini and Union Minister Kiren Rijiju have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of widespread voter fraud during the Haryana assembly elections. Gandhi presented 'H-Files' alleging a theft of 25 lakh votes, including duplicate and invalid entries. Saini accused Gandhi of misleading the nation with lies, while Rijiju questioned the impact of Gandhi's 'atom bomb' allegations.

title: Democrats Trump Donald in first electoral setback for US President
content: Democrats secured significant victories in recent elections, winning governorships in Virginia and New Jersey, and local polls, including New York City. These wins are seen as a rebuke of President Donald Trump's influence, with women and minorities triumphing over Trump-backed candidates. The results signal a potential shift in political momentum.

title: Big test for Trump's tariff war: US SC to decide legalities - what is US admin's Plan B?
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear arguments on President Trump's sweeping tariffs, imposed under emergency powers, potentially altering presidential authority and global trade. Lower courts found the tariffs exceeded executive power, but the administration argues they protect national security. A ruling could impact billions in collected duties and set a precedent for future trade policy.

title: Envoy to represent India at COP30 Leaders' Summit; Environment Minister Yadav to join later
content: At COP30, India is expected to underline that developed countries can restore trust by honouring their past commitments and scaling up predictable, grant-based funding for adaptation and loss and damage

title: 'Drishyam'-style murder in Ahmedabad: Man's body buried in his house; wife's paramour held
content: Ansari, who used to work as mason, came to Ahmedabad from Bihar in 2016 after his love marriage with Ruby and the couple has two children

title: NREGA Sangharsh Morcha threatens protests in Bengal if MGNREGA not resumed by December
content: The Supreme Court of India on October 27 has removed all the road blocks in the resumption of the MGNREGA scheme by dismissing the petition of the Union government. Prior to this the Calcutta High Court has directed the resumption of the scheme from August 1

title: Trinamool using SIR to deflect attention from its 14- year misrule in Bengal, says BJP
content: WB BJP president Samik Bhattacharya said that the Trinamool Congress can always approach the Supreme Court if the party has any opposition to the SIR.

title: Siblings arrested in Coimbatore gang rape case were on police watchlist
content: T. Karuppasamy, alias Satheesh, 30, and T. Kaleeswaran, alias Karthik, 21, were among the 3,000 history-sheeters in the list, which included local history-sheeters and those from other districts.

title: Anyone intimidating society through illegal land grabs to be penalized, warns U.P. CM Yogi
content: Mr. Adityanath made the remarks after inaugurating the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Housing Scheme at Ekta Van in Dalibagh in Lucknow on the occasion of Kartik Purnima where he handed over allotment letters of flats to 72 Economically Weaker Section (EWS) families

title: KKRTC staff urged to take part in sports for physical and mental fitness: chairman Arun Kumar
content: Participation in sports is essential for both physical and mental well-being, said Kalyana Karnataka Road Transport Corporation chairman Arun Kumar Patil

title: Nandini ghee price goes up by ₹90 per kg
content: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) effected a steep increase of nearly 15% on the price of its popular product, Nandini ghee, from Wednesday.

title: ‘No surprise if BJP and alliance do not reach even three digits’: Congress MP Pramod Tiwari ahead of Bihar polls
content: This time, Nitish Kumar's inability to work, his inability to tour, and the way the BJP has ignored him will lead to a reduction in the BJP's seats, the Congress MP said

title: NDA stands for HIRA; Bihar witnessed tremendous growth under Modi, Nitish: BJP president Nadda
content: Mr. Nadda described the RJD as a party of "Rangdari [extortion], Jungle Raj [anarchy] and Dadagiri [intimidation]," and accused its leaders, including Mr. Lalu, Ms. Rabri, Mr. Tejashwi and Misa Bharti, of being out on bail

title: Former Assam MP joins regional party, slams ‘authoritarian’ BJP
content: Rajen Gohain is among those with an RSS past said to be disenchanted with the BJP’s “imported” breed of leaders

title: RCB ownership may change hands; USL initiates strategic review of the investment
content: Investment in sport, although valuable and strategic, is not the company’s core business, says Someshwar, Managing Director, USL

title: SHRC seeks report on condition of ventilators at SAT Hospital
content: Superintendent of Government Medical College Hospital, Thiruvananthapuram, denies  media reports that  11 ventilators at the hospital are not in a working condition. Commission says report must be submitted within a month

title: Labour Minister condemns Pakistan’s abuse of global forum to ‘peddle disinformation’
content: The Union Labour Minister counters Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari’s statement at the World Summit for Social Development in Doha that India weaponises water

title: Shifting candidates and strategies, parties aim to win the crucial Magadh region in Bihar
content: While the NDA faces the challenge of regaining lost turf in what was once its stronghold, the Mahagathbandhan is going all out to maintain its dominance for the third consecutive term in the Magadh region

title: 38 divisions in Kochi Corporation reserved for women after fresh draw of lots
content: The initial draw was challenged in the High Court for erroneously reserving a division that had already been reserved for women in the 2020 elections

title: Yet another straight duel between LDF and UDF on the cards in Pala
content: The once-uneasy alliance between the CPI(M) and KC(M) has evolved into a cohesive partnership with strong grassroots chemistry, while the UDF looks to win back what once its bastion. The Bharatiya Janata Party, buoyed by an expanding ground network, looks to play the dark horse

title: Stubble-burning area in key Punjab districts 20% lower than last year
content: In the week from October 28 to November 4, fire counts have tripled; citing the recent data, expert says reduction in area set afire in three major districts a positive sign

title: FATF releases updated asset recovery framework; India played a key role, says Enforcement Directorate
content: The guidance follows up on one of the most significant global reforms to the FATF standards on confiscation and international cooperation in over three decades, the ED said

title: Defeat BJP-JD(U) to rid Bihar of unemployment, migration, 'goonda raj': Congress' appeal to voters
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh alleged that the NDA has pushed Bihar's bright future into darkness for the sake of its own "power-hungry interests"

title: Archives department to preserve satirist Veloor’s handwritten manuscripts
content: Department decides to take over 20 of Veloor’s most significant handwritten manuscripts, conserve and return them to his kin

title: Bihar polls: JD(U)’s Lalan claims FIR based on ‘doctored’ video
content: Lalan expressed confidence that the investigation will take into account “the full video footage” and will lead to his exoneration

title: Police file FIR in Bilaspur train crash
content: Police say initial findings by Railways, which suggest that the passenger train’s crew failed to control the train at a red signal, will be part of their probe; Commissioner of Railway Safety to begin investigation, says government

title: Chhattisgarh train collision: With parents dead, relatives of toddler who survived worried about his future
content: Rishi, around two years old, sustained injuries on his head and legs in train accident in Chhattisgarh’s Bilaspur

title: First phase of Bihar polls on November 6 will decide the fate of big leaders and small parties
content: The Opposition’s CM face Tejashwi Yadav is in the fray, as are Deputy CMs Samrat Choudhary and V.K. Sinha; crucial test for CPI(ML), LJP(RV), VIP; in 2020, Mahagatbandhan won 63 of 121 seats going to polls

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy mocks KTR’s debate challenge, asks him to engage with Cantonment MLA
content: Says Congress workers were not taking the BRS working president’s latest challenge seriously since he had “run away” from earlier debates

title: Only Central govt., not the State, has jurisdiction over BMRCL’s industrial disputes: Karnataka High Court
content: Court also quashes State govt.’s notifications declaring BMRCL’s services as ‘public utility’ and ‘essential services’

title: Three-way contest sharpens in Jubilee Hills as voting day draws near
content: Parties are eyeing the Muslim vote, estimated at around 1.4 lakh of the constituency’s little over 4 lakh electors

title: BJP to mark 150 years of ‘Vande Mataram’ with nationwide recitations from November 7
content: Prime Minister Modi likely to attend central event in Delhi as BJP plans celebrations at 150 iconic sites across the country

title: Caste survey delay, internal disagreements stall GBA ward delimitation
content: The entire exercise was designed to culminate in the publication of draft ward-wise electoral rolls by December first week, followed by a period of claims and objections until late December, and the final publication of the rolls on January 29, 2026, crucial for keeping the city’s long-pending civic polls on track

title: Tribal family to World Cup glory: Kranti Goud’s journey from a backup player in boys’ team to India pacer
content: Like many of her peers in India’s World Cup winning team, Kranti’s story too began in a small town as she navigated through resistance, challenges, lack of resources and financial hardships to the historic moment at the DY Patil Stadium on the night of November 2, 2025

title: Cabinet decides to regularise contract workers at KPPL
content: A total of 181 contract employees to be offered permanent position at the Kerala Paper Products Limited

title: India’s new AI governance guidelines push hands-off approach
content: While an earlier draft focussed on minimising risks, the new framework seeks to promote innovation with guardrails, without “throttling” AI adoption; Centre has no immediate plan to introduce a new AI law

title: Women bus ridership up 78% on metro feeder routes in north-west Bengaluru after Shakti scheme launch: Study
content: Jalahalli Cross consistently ranked in top 30 metro feeder routes across Bengaluru throughout 2023 to 2025

title: Karnataka to introduce AI as part of reforms for district judiciary
content: Karnataka District Judiciary Reforms Bill, 2025, also seeks to set up fast track courts to dispose of cases in 12 months; restrictions on adjournments and guidelines for injunction

title: Ours is a people-centric govt., focussed on welfare of poor, says Telangana Deputy CM
content: Cong. government is implementing spree of welfare and development schemes since coming to power, says Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka

title: TDP State president warns of stringent action against leaders bringing disrepute to party
content: Palla Srinivasa Rao also insists on completing the formation of committees from the village level to the constituencies before November 15 and conducting grievance redress programmes as desired

title: State to launch OTT platform to promote Kannada cinema globally: Mehaboob Pasha
content: The Karnataka government will soon launch its own over-the-top (OTT) platform to provide a global stage for Kannada films, said Mehaboob Pasha, Chairman of Kanteerava Studios Limited, at a press conference in Bidar

title: Was denied entry into Pakistan with Sikh group: pilgrim

title: ‘86 projects completed during undivided A.P. helped improve green cover in rural areas’

title: Kerala launches KL-90 series for government vehicles
content: As per final notification,  government vehicles will be registered in KL-90 and KL-90D series.  Some numbers will be reserved specifically for Ministers, high-ranking government officials, protocol vehicles, and other designated individuals

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Kerala HC asks SIT to check if TDB officials can be tried under Prevention of Corruption Act

content:
V Senthil Kumaran is currently working as the Special Correspondent for The Times of India, focusing on the districts of Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri, Krishnagiri, and Erode.
As the sole representative for these five districts in Western Tamil Nadu, Senthil Kumaran covers a wide range of topics, including crime, education, and civic issues. He has exposed numerous scams and held several government officials accountable for their actions.
In addition to his journalism work, he holds an MBA in Human Resources, an M.Sc. in Psychotherapy, and an LLB, along with a BA in English Literature. Read More

title: Why only J&K? Oppn questions Omar govt's order to 'verify' journalists
content: new rules meant to "monitor and restrict media" were being selectively enforced in only one part of the country . the opposition questioned the motive behind the government's exhaustive id checklist . "the election in J&K was meant to restore trust and dignity, not to replace one silence with another," the opposition says .

title: Agniveer wounded in J&K’s Kishtwar, hunt on for 3 terrorists
content: the joint operation by army and police began after intelligence inputs pointed to the presence of terrorists in the area . at least three terrorists are hiding there, a source says . a 22-year-old Agniveer attached to 11 Rashtriya Rifles was wounded .

title: Men's boxing divisional rankings: Joshua Buatsi wins but drops three spots?
content: the light heavyweight fight was marred by clinching and a lack of action . the decision was widely panned on social media as the early work by Zach Parker appeared to give him the edge against the betting favorite . a third of the judges saw it 96-94 and 95-95 .

title: Pro-Pak LED board slogans land 2 Goa store owners behind bars
content: Gauree Malkarnekar, senior correspondent at The Times of India, Goa, maintains a hawk's eye on Goa's expansive education sector. And when she is not chasing schools, headmasters and teachers, she turns her focus to crime. Her entry into journalism was purely accidental: a trained commercial artist, she landed her first job as a graphic designer with a weekly, but less than a fortnight later set aside the brush and picked up the pen. Ever since she has not complained. Read More

title: 2 held for spycam in bath of Tata firm's women's hostel
content: a woman and her boyfriend were arrested on charges of installing a hidden camera in a bathroom of a women's hostel in Krishnagiri district of Tamil Nadu . the accused are Neelukumari Gupta (22) from Odisha, an employee of the company at its Nagamangalam facility .

title: Not ceremonial like in India, US mayors are CEOs of cities
content: new york, los Angeles and Chicago are among cities that follow the 'strong-mayor system' in which mayors don't report to a political executive, like in india, but draw their powers directly from the Constitution . the mayor is largely ceremonial, with little executive authority .

title: Immigration woes: Canada unveils new plan; why its bad news for int'l students
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: Haryana polls 'stolen', 25 lakh voters were fake in elections: Rahul Gandhi
content: 'Cong Lost By 22K Votes On 8 Seats, By 1.2L Votes In All' alleged that 25 lakh fake voters participated in the state polls that Congress lost by 22,000 votes on eight seats and by 1.18 lakh votes in all . 'your future is being Stolen': Rahul Gandhi's Bold Message to India's Gen Z For Democratic Change .

title: Officials say these men are poachers: One's blind, another's ill and in chains
content: Krishna Chaudhary, a mass communication graduate, is a Senior Correspondent covering the sugar belt of Western Uttar Pradesh. He loves reporting on crime, politics, and impactful human-interest stories. Read More

title: EC hits back at Rahul, asks why didn't you file appeal
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: Trump says lost 'sovereignty' in New York — then breaks into his dance: Watch
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Where do things stand following the first committee ranking?
content: the lone ACC team in the bracket if it were released today would be no. 14 Virginia . the ACC is already playing from behind, and it's only the first ranking of the season . teams with Would be in status below are in this week's bracket based on the committee ranking .

title: Fast break: Morant's struggles, Kuminga's breakout and more
content: we'll start with a high-altitude view of the league and zoom in on the details that matter . we have to talk about Giannis Antetokounmpo . he's averaged 34.0 points per game on 68.1% shooting through six contests .

title: Ducks, Hawkeyes, trench football: Why you should bet the under on Oregon-Iowa
content: Oregon is 7-1 overall and 4-1 in the Big Ten, but now comes a trip to Iowa . the Hawkeyes sit at 6-2 and 4--1 in conference play, just outside the top 25 at no. 26 in the AP poll .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Women's college volleyball Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: the women's college volleyball season is in the stretch run . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
content: the college football playoff committee has released its first top 25 ranking of the year . it's the sport's version of Walmart opening its doors at midnight on black Friday . this year, the committee has said it is considering a new "record strength" metric .

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi, 2 deputy CMs, 13 mantris in 1st-phase battle today; voting in 121 seats
content: a total of 1,314 candidates are in the fray, their fate to be sealed in 45,341 polling stations across 18 districts . of its 15 ministers, 10 belong to BJP, including deputy CMs Samrat Choudhary (Tarapur) and Vijay Kumar Sinha (Lakhisarai), and five are from JD(U)

title: The Bilas Index: Jay Bilas picks his top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: ⬇ Bottom 10: Georgia Tech latest to be wrecked
content: we love college football most of all for its dedication to traditions . "November Rain," guns N' Roses Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, is located in the very empty wardrobe box . a season of Auburn football penning more drama than a "General Host" season .

title: Stroud out vs. Jags; QB Mills to start for Texans
content: texans coach deMeco Ryans says he's "feeling a little bit better" after hitting his head on the ground . backup quarterback Davis Mills will get the nod, according to Ryans . the Texans want to see how Stroud progresses throughout week .
